thread.title: 5 Must To See Tourist Places In Brussels Belgium
thread.title_full: 5 Must To See Tourist Places In Brussels Belgium

author: admin
title: 5 Must To See Tourist Places In Brussels Belgium
text:
Home > Travel Destinations > 5 Must To See Tourist Places In Brussels Belgium 5 Must To See Tourist Places In Brussels Belgium By admin on July 20, 2015 Pin It 
Brussels serves as the capital of Belgium as well as the European Union. This is a place known for its historic sites, places of great interest and immense beauty. The tourist places in Brussels Belgium are the ones that should not be missed during a trip to Europe. 
In Brussels, you will come face to face with the grandeur and the royalty of primeval European buildings that add to the splendor of the city. 
Apart from this, you will also find modern skyscrapers showcasing contemporary architecture. This way the city serves as a connection between the past and the present. Top Tourist Places In Brussels, Belgium 
Here are some of the must to see tourist places in Brussels Belgium during your visit. Grand Place 
Grand Place is basically a town square which is surrounded by towering old buildings. Formerly, this palace served as the location for execution of prisoners but at present it serves as one of the most popular tourist attractions in Brussels. At present, this place is also used in the form of a venue for cultural festivals. Manneken Pis 
This is one of the best-known landmarks in Brussels visited by a large number of tourists every year. The origin of the statue of a young boy urinating is traced back to the year 1388 but there is nothing much that is known about the statue. The small boy is also called the oldest citizen of Brussels. Atomium 
This is another popular landmark of Brussels. You need to use a tram in order to get to this place. Atomium is a 102 meter high aluminum and steel structures that had been designed by Andre Waterkeyn for Brussels World exhibition held in the year 1958. At this building you will find the representation of an iron molecule magnified 165 million times. Mini-Europe 
Mini-Europe is the name given to a miniature park located in Bruparck. This park represents approximately 350 buildings and 80 cities. You will also find a number of live actions representations like cable cars, trains and mills at this park. Belgian Comic Strip Center 
The Belgian Comic Strip Center is a gorgeous building constructed in the year 1906. Victor Horta designed this building which is devoted to the rich history of comic strips and cartoons in Belgium.
